message.content:
cs.DL, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.SOC, cs.DB

The paper proposes a new metric for ranking scientific authors based on a weighted multi-layered network. This metric is tested on a massive publication dataset of Computer Science. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.DL (Digital Libraries) which deals with the management, dissemination, and use of digital information. Other likely sub-categories include cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.SOC (Social and Information Networks), and cs.DB (Databases). These sub-categories are relevant because they deal with topics related to network analysis, ranking, and information retrieval, which are all relevant to the proposed metric.
